p.k: Ogawa Niki explores the back alleys and long traditions of fishing towns in the Toba Islands (Mie Pref.). On this program, get to know the real Japan and discover useful travel tips.
p.d: The Ise-Shima National Park is one of Japan's most popular sightseeing areas, but not so many people visit the islands that lie offshore from Toba City. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Ogawa Niki visits 2 of those islands. In Toshijima he explores the back alleys of a fishing town, where the distinctive tradition and local culture remain strong. And in Kamishima he discovers the setting for a novel that has become one of Japan's most popular love stories.
